snippet: N.F.L. owners nearly tripled Commissioner Roger Goodell’s compensation in the 2011 tax year to $29.49 million.  According to the league’s most recent tax return, much of Goodell’s pay came in the form of a $22.3 million bonus.
abstract: Tax records show NFL commissioner Roger Goodell made $29.49 million in 2011; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: N.F.L. owners nearly tripled Commissioner Roger Goodell’s compensation in the 2011 tax year to $29.49 million.  According to the league’s most recent tax return, much of Goodell’s pay came in the form of a $22.3 million bonus.

headline.main: A $22.3 Million Bonus for N.F.L. Commissioner
